meanings.definition: An official list or record of names or items.
meanings.sent1: The school keeps a register of all the students' names.
meanings.sent2: The register at the library helps keep track of borrowed books.
meanings.sent3: The register of attendees at the party was accidentally left behind.
meanings.sent4: Her face was a register of emotions, from joy to sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The register of endangered species is crucial for conservation efforts.

meanings.definition: To enter or record information in an official list or record.
meanings.sent1: Please register your name at the front desk.
meanings.sent2: I need to register for the conference before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: He tried to register the new data, but the system crashed.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the bell seemed to register in her mind as a warning.
meanings.sent5: Make sure to register your vote before the polls close.

meanings.definition: To show or express a particular quality or emotion.
meanings.sent2: His surprise registered clearly on his face.
meanings.sent3: The dog's tail wagging wildly registered its excitement.
meanings.sent4: The impact of the news finally registered in her mind.
meanings.sent5: His words failed to register the seriousness of the situation.

meanings.definition: A range or variety of a particular quality or characteristic.
meanings.sent1: The store offers a wide register of colors for the paint.
meanings.sent2: The register of flavors in the ice cream shop is impressive.
meanings.sent3: The register of skills required for the job was extensive.
meanings.sent4: The register of scents in the garden was overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The register of emotions in the play resonated with the audience.
